alert.note: Alert for Richland (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:56PM CDT until April 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN EAST CARROLL...NORTHWESTERN MADISON...NORTHEASTERN RICHLAND...SOUTH CENTRAL WEST CARROLL AND NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN PARISHES... At 656 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Delhi, or 16 miles west of Tallulah, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Tendal around 705 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Epps. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
